entry.title: The Immigration (Suspension of Detainee Custody Officer Certificate) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: Paragraph 7 of Schedule 11 to the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 provides that if it appears to the escort monitor or (as the case may be) contract monitor that a detainee custody officer is not a fit and proper person to perform escort duties or (as the case may be) custodial duties he may refer the matter to the Secretary of State or may, in prescribed circumstances, suspend the officer’s certificate pending the Secretary of State’s decision as to whether to revoke it.

entry.title: The Lincoln District Healthcare and the South Lincolnshire Healthcare National Health Service Trusts (Dissolution) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order dissolves on 1st April 2001 the Lincoln District Healthcare National Health Service Trust and the South Lincolnshire Healthcare National Health Service Trust.

entry.title: The Detention Centre (Specified Diseases) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order specifies certain diseases for the purpose of paragraph 3 of Schedule 12 to the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999.

entry.title: The Newcastle City Health and the Northumberland Mental Health National Health Service Trusts (Dissolution) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order dissolves on 1st April 2001 the Newcastle City Health Service Trust and the Northumberland Mental Health National Health Service Trust.

entry.title: The Lincolnshire Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Lincolnshire Healthcare National Health Service Trust, an NHS trust provided for in section 5 of the National Health Service and Community Care Act 1990.

entry.title: The Newcastle, North Tyneside and Northumberland Mental Health National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Newcastle, North Tyneside and Northumberland Mental Health National Health Service Trust, an NHS trust provided for in section 5 of the National Health Service and Community Care Act 1990.

entry.title: The Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 (Commencement No. 9) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order brings into force, certain provisions of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999.

entry.title: The Leeds Supertram (Land Acquisition and Road Works) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order confers fresh powers of compulsory acquisition on West Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive and Leeds City Council for the purposes of the works authorised by the Leeds Supertram Act 1993. Powers of compulsory acquisition under that Act expired on 26th July 1998.

entry.title: The Leeds Supertram (Extension) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order authorises the West Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive to construct works and compulsorily to acquire land for the purpose of extending the tramway system authorised by the Leeds Supertram Act 1993 between Leeds City Centre and Seacroft in the City of Leeds.

entry.title: The Legal Advice and Assistance (Scope) (Amendment) Regulations 2001

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Advice and Assistance (Scope) Regulations 1989 (S.I. 1989/550) so as to make assistance by way of representation available to a person in respect of whom an application is made for a warrant of further detention, or an extension of such a warrant, under Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Code of Practice on Audio Recording of Interviews) (No. 2) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order requires interviews of persons detained under Schedule 7 (Port and Border Controls) or section 41 (arrest without warrant of a person reasonably suspected of being a terrorist) of the Terrorism Act 2000, which are conducted by a constable at a police station, to be audio recorded in accordance with the code of practice made for the purpose. “Police station” includes any place which the Secretary of State has designated under paragraph 1(1) of Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000 as a place where a person may be detained under section 41 of that Act.

entry.title: The Solihull Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order dissolves on 1st April 2001 the Solihull Healthcare National Health Service Trust.

entry.title: The Education Standards Fund 2000 (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Education Standards Fund (England) Regulations 2000. They add a new purpose for or in connection with which grant is payable. The new purpose relates to projects to assist groups which provide educational and play activities suitable for children below compulsory school age. They also make a consequential amendment to regulation 5(2).

entry.title: The Legal Advice and Assistance (Amendment) Regulations 2001

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These regulations are consequential on the Legal Advice and Assitance (Scope) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/ ), which make assistance by way of representation (ABWOR) available to a person in respect of whom an application is made for a warrant of further detention, or an extension of such a warrant, under Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000. They amend the Legal Advice and Assistance Regulations 1989 (S.I. 1989/340) so that, in relation to such cases:

entry.title: The Strategic Rail Authority (Capital Allowances) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order makes provision relating to the expenditure which the Strategic Rail Authority, for the purposes of capital allowances under the Corporation Tax Acts, is to be taken as having incurred on certain plant and machinery which is transferred to it under provisions in Part IV of the Transport Act 2000.

entry.title: The Solihull Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Solihull Primary Care Trust (“the trust”), as provided for under section 16A of the National Health Service Act 1977. It specifies the area for which the trust is established (article 3 and Schedule 1), its operational date (article 5) and limitations on the exercise of its functions during its preparatory period (article 6). It makes provision for the membership of the trust (article 4) and for assistance to the trust during its preparatory period (article 7).

entry.title: The Child Support (Consequential Amendments and Transitional Provisions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the amendment of various Regulations and Orders and make savings and transitional provisions.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Code of Practice on Audio Recording of Interviews) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order appoints 19th February as the date on which the code of practice on the audio recording of interviews by police officers of persons detained in a police station under the Terrorism Act 2000 comes into operation. `Police station' includes any place which the Secretary of State has designated under paragraph 1(1) of Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000 as a place where a person may be detained under section 41 of that Act.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Crown Servants and Regulators) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations apply to the Director of Savings and his employees and servants, when carrying on certain financial business under regulation 4 of the Money Laundering Regulations 1993, the provisions of the Terrorism Act 2000 relating to terrorist property offences. In addition the Regulations disapply section 19 of the Act (offence of failing to disclose a belief or suspicion, where it arises in the course of a trade, business or employment, that a terrorist property offence has been committed) in relation to the persons referred to in regulation 4.

entry.title: The Channel Tunnel (International Arrangements) (Amendment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends the Channel Tunnel (International Arrangements) Order 1993 as a consequence of the repeal of the Prevention of Terrorism (Temporary Provisions) Act 1989 and its replacement by the Terrorism Act 2000, so that the 2000 Act can apply, with such modifications as are appropriate, in respect of the Channel Tunnel system.
